briefdescription.para: output message vector for thruster data
kg/s Current mass flow rate of thrusters
pointer to the hub attitude states
pointer to the hub angular velocity states
[m] r_N inertial position relative to system spice zeroBase/refBase
vector of body states message where the thrusters attach to
Time for previous valid thruster firing

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to link the states to the thrusters
void
states
The states to link

This method computes the Forces on Torque on the Spacecraft Body.
void
integTime
Integration time
timeStep
Current integration time step used

listitem.para: Zero out the structure force/torque for the thruster set
Iterate through all of the thrusters to aggregate the force/torque in the system
For each thruster see if the on-time is still valid and if so, call ComputeThrusterFire()
If we are not actively firing, continue shutdown process for active thrusters
For each thruster, aggregate the current thrust direction into composite body force
Compute the point B relative torque and aggregate into the composite body torque
Add the mass depletion force contribution
Add the mass depletion torque contribution
Once all thrusters have been checked, update time-related variables for next evaluation
Iterate through all of the thrusters to aggregate the force/torque in the system

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to reset the module.
void

listitem.para: Clear out any currently firing thrusters and re-init cmd array

briefdescription.para: Add a new thruster to the thruster set.
(overloaded) Add a new thruster to the thruster set connect to a body different than the hub

detaileddescription.para:
This method is the main cyclical call for the scheduled part of the thruster dynamics model. It reads the current commands array and sets the thruster configuration data based on that incoming command set. Note that the main dynamical method (ComputeDynamics()) is not called here and is intended to be called from the dynamics plant in the system
void
CurrentSimNanos
The current simulation time in nanoseconds

listitem.para: Read the inputs and then call ConfigureThrustRequests to set up dynamics

detaileddescription.para:
This method is here to write the output message structure into the specified message.
CurrentClock
The current time used for time-stamping the message
void

This method is used to read the incoming command message and set the associated command structure for operating the thrusters.
void

listitem.para: read the incoming command array
Check if message has already been read, if stale return
Set the NewThrustCmds vector. Using the data() method for raw speed

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to read the new commands vector and set the thruster firings appropriately. It assumes that the ReadInputs method has already been run successfully. It honors all previous thruster firings if they are still active. Note that for unit testing purposes you can insert firings directly into NewThrustCmds.
void
currentTime
The current simulation time converted to a double

listitem.para: Iterate through the list of thruster commands that we read in.
Check to see if we have met minimum for each thruster
For each case where we are above the minimum firing request, reset the thruster
Will ensure that thruster shuts down once this cmd expires

inbodydescription.para: After we have assigned the firing to the internal thruster, zero the command request.

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to get the current force for a thruster firing. It uses the configuration data associated with a given thruster and the current clock time to determine what state and force the thruster should be in.
void
CurrentThruster
Pointer to the configuration data for a given thruster
currentTime
The current simulation clock time converted to a double

listitem.para: Set the current ramp time for the thruster firing
Iterate through the on-ramp for the thruster data to find where we are in ramp
If the current on-time is less than the ramp delta, set that ramp thrust factor
If we did not find the current time in the on-ramp, then we are at steady-state

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to go through the process of shutting down a thruster once it has been commanded off. It uses the configuration data associated with a given thruster and the current clock time to turn off the thruster according to the ramp profile.
void
CurrentThruster
Pointer to the configuration data for a given thruster
currentTime
The current simulation clock time converted to a double

listitem.para: Set the current off-ramp time based on the previous clock time and now
Iterate through the off-ramp to find the place where we are in the shutdown ramp
Once we find the location in the off-ramp, set that thrust factor to current
If we did not find the location in the off-ramp, we've reached the end state and zero thrust

detaileddescription.para:
This method is used to update the location and orientation of the thrusters at every UpdateState call when the thrusters are attached to a body other than the hub.
void

This method finds the location in the time in the specified ramp that corresponds to the current thruster thrust factor. It is designed to initialize the ramp-up and ramp-down effects to the appropriate point in their respective ramps based on the initial force
double The time in the ramp associated with the thrust factor
thrData
The data for the thruster that we are currently firing
thrRamp
This just allows us to avoid switching to figure out which ramp

listitem.para: Grab the last element in the ramp and determine if it goes up or down
Initialize the time computation functiosn based on ramp direction
Determine if we haven't reached the right place in the ramp
If we have not located the location in the ramp, continue
Linearly interpolate between the points, check for numerical garbage, and return clean interpolation
